page.title: 02LEAFIELD ESTATE, CORSHAM
page.content: This industrial estate has been developed over the last ten years.Some twenty factories provide work for many people. We visited several of the factories including Kirk Dysons which makes trade plastic mouldings.They make 30,000 balls a year for ballbarrows. They also make toilet extensions for old people and hospital wards as well as plastic street bins. It covers about 2 acres of land and employs 27 people. They export to France, Germany, Ireland, Singapore and they import from Germany. On another visit we went to Carfax Waste Paper Factory which buys up all kinds of waste paper, anything from cardboard to cheque stubs. This is sorted, cut up, baled and sold. The factory can recycle paper up to 4 times and 1 tonne of cardboard equals 17 trees, we were told.
